remarks: An edge of a graph is a proper pair, i.e. a set containing two different elements (the endvertices of the edge), analogous to ~ umgrale and ~ usgraedg2 .  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 11-Aug-2017.) (Revised by AV, 9-Jan-2020.)
statement:
usgedgppr.e $e |- E = ( Edges ` G ) $.
usgedgppr $p |- ( ( G e. USGrph /\ C e. E ) -> ( # ` C ) = 2 ) $.
